page.title: 02South View and Riverdene
page.content: {Houses}in{Shooters Way}were{terraced and{built}in{1947.}They were{linked}by small{sheds}and we thought that they were really nearly{semi_detached.}They were made of{red bricks}with{slanting {roofs.}In{Denes Close}the houses were two years older and were made of {concrete slabs.}At{Riveredene}the houses there were only{thirteen years old, ones that had been taken care of looked{brand new.}In{Lune Close}some had a{small porch,}they all had{flat {roofs}with alot of{wood facing}on the outside of them where the wood had rotted plastic replacements had been put on. The gardens here were smaller. I{prefere}the houses at Riverdene, although they were terraced they looked alot bigger and they had all been well looked after. The{roads}were much{tidier}too. By Nathan Jokhoo
